title: Danger to Society
description: Camille Marino founded Negotiation Is Over in 2009 and began re-publishing the personal information of animal abusers around the globe. She has been engaged in a contentious initiative to expose and dismantle the vivisection industry inside the University of Florida. After winning her first lawsuit against them on December 30, 2011 and they hit back hard... On July 13, 2012, she was declared a "Danger to Society" and thrown into jail on a $500,000 bond. This book begins in her cell in Detroit. By the time it ends, she had been subjected to 6 arrests, 2 extraditions, 1 raid on her home, 3 months on house arrest, 8 months in jail, and 7 months being banned from the internet, all computers, and all forms of activism. Ultimately, a picture emerges of the extraordinary depths to which the vivisection complex will sink to silence dissenters and keep their secrets hidden from the light of day. Fortunately, they failed!
author: Camille Marino
